intro: Phaeocephalum pallidum, commonly known as the pale-headed flax lily, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and striking pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is often found in dune environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
